[grid@dc-core-db-01 admin]$ vi listener.ora
[grid@dc-core-db-01 admin]$ cat listener.ora
# listener.ora Network Configuration File: /u01/app/grid/product/12.1.0/grid/network/admin/listener.ora
# Generated by Oracle configuration tools.

ENABLE_GLOBAL_DYNAMIC_ENDPOINT_LISTENER_SCAN3 = ON

ENABLE_GLOBAL_DYNAMIC_ENDPOINT_LISTENER_SCAN2 = ON

ENABLE_GLOBAL_DYNAMIC_ENDPOINT_LISTENER_SCAN1 = ON

VALID_NODE_CHECKING_REGISTRATION_LISTENER_SCAN3 = OFF

VALID_NODE_CHECKING_REGISTRATION_LISTENER_SCAN2 = OFF

VALID_NODE_CHECKING_REGISTRATION_LISTENER_SCAN1=OFF             # line added by Agent

VALID_NODE_CHECKING_REGISTRATION_LISTENER = SUBNET

#TCTSCH
ADMIN_RESTRICTIONS_LISTENER = ON
ADMIN_RESTRICTIONS_LISTENER_SCAN1 = ON
ADMIN_RESTRICTIONS_LISTENER_SCAN2 = ON
ADMIN_RESTRICTIONS_LISTENER_SCAN3 = ON

LISTENER =
  (DESCRIPTION =
    (ADDRESS_LIST =
      (ADDRESS = (PROTOCOL = IPC)(KEY = LISTENER))
    )
  )

ENABLE_GLOBAL_DYNAMIC_ENDPOINT_LISTENER = ON

LISTENER_SCAN3 =
  (DESCRIPTION =
    (ADDRESS_LIST =
      (ADDRESS = (PROTOCOL = IPC)(KEY = LISTENER_SCAN3))
    )
  )

LISTENER_SCAN2 =
  (DESCRIPTION =
    (ADDRESS_LIST =
      (ADDRESS = (PROTOCOL = IPC)(KEY = LISTENER_SCAN2))
    )
  )

LISTENER_SCAN1 =
  (DESCRIPTION =
    (ADDRESS_LIST =
      (ADDRESS = (PROTOCOL = IPC)(KEY = LISTENER_SCAN1))
    )
  )

[grid@dc-core-db-01 admin]$ lsnrctl reload LISTENER_SCAN1

   Linux Error: 2: No such file or directory

SYS@t24rptdc_2 > CREATE FUNCTION "SYS"."ORA_VERIFY_FUNCTION"
(username varchar2,
 password varchar2,
 old_password varchar2)
RETURN boolean IS
  2    3    4    5    6     differ integer;
   db_name varchar2(40);
   i integer;
BEGIN
   IF NOT ora_complexity_check(password, chars => 12, upper => 1, lower => 1, digit => 1, special => 1) THEN
      RETURN(FALSE);
   END IF;
  7    8    9   10   11   12   13
   -- Check if the password contains the server name
   select name into db_name from sys.v$database;
   IF regexp_instr(password, db_name, 1, 1, 0, 'i') > 0 THEN
      raise_application_error(-20004, 'Password contains the server name');
 14   15   16   17   18     END IF;

   -- Check if the password contains 'oracle'
 19   20   21     IF regexp_instr(password, 'oracle', 1, 1, 0, 'i') > 0 THEN
        raise_application_error(-20006, 'Password too simple');
   END IF;
 22   23   24
   -- Check if the password differs from the previous password by at least
   -- 3 characters
 25   26   27     IF old_password IS NOT NULL THEN
     differ := ora_string_distance(old_password, password);
     IF differ < 3 THEN
 28   29   30          raise_application_error(-20010, 'Password should differ from the '
 31                                  || 'old password by at least 3 characters');
 32       END IF;
   END IF ;

   RETURN(TRUE);
END;
 33   34   35   36   37  /

Function created.

SYS@t24rptdc_2 > GRANT EXECUTE ON ORA_VERIFY_FUNCTION TO PUBLIC;
GRANT EXECUTE ON ORA_COMPLEXITY_CHECK TO PUBLIC;
GRANT EXECUTE ON ORA_STRING_DISTANCE TO PUBLIC;
Grant succeeded.

SYS@t24rptdc_2 >
Grant succeeded.

SYS@t24rptdc_2 > Alter PROFILE "PROFILE_ENDUSER" LIMIT
  2    PASSWORD_VERIFY_FUNCTION ORA_VERIFY_FUNCTION;

Alter PROFILE "PROFILE_SERVICE_ACCOUNT" LIMIT
PASSWORD_VERIFY_FUNCTION ORA_VERIFY_FUNCTION;

CREATE PROFILE "DBA_PROFILE" LIMIT
PASSWORD_LIFE_TIME UNLIMITED
FAILED_LOGIN_ATTEMPTS 5
GRANT EXECUTE ON ORA_STRING_DISTANCE TO PUBLIC;Alter PROFILE "PROFILE_ENDUSER" LIMIT
                                              *
ERROR at line 1:
ORA-00933: SQL command not properly ended
